abstract: Despite moves in Congress to change Chapter 11 venue rules, the Delaware court ignored any political pressure to name a trustee in the Solyndra bankruptcy.
snippet: Despite moves in Congress to change Chapter 11 venue rules, the Delaware court ignored any political pressure to name a trustee in the Solyndra bankruptcy.
lead_paragraph: Given all the important economic legislation and issues that Congress might be considering, it is probably not too much of a surprise that lawmakers are spending time on the question of whether corporate bankruptcy cases should be as clustered in New York and Delaware as they are.

headline.main: Bankruptcy Venue and the Delaware Solyndra Ruling
